I was greatly affected by this, even though I am in remission of my kidney disease I still need to go in monthly for appointments that cost $1k+ because I have no insurance because I physically can't work. If you could even refund 25% it will be greatly appreciated. Thank you guys so much for allowing me to plead my case. I am just trying to live my best life.

This job brings in very little money. In my free time, I participate in ambassador programs and incentivized testnets of various blockchain projects. Here are some projects I've been involved with NuCypher, Harmony, Avalanche, Elrond, Solana, Stafi, CertiK, XX network, Akash, Mina, Blockstack, Keep, Bitsong, Mina. I accumulated several years of rewards from these events, saved for my retirement and hoped to buy a house. I am already 41 years old. I have a wife and two children aged 7 and 9. We live in Ukraine, the city of Dnipro. So far, we are relatively calm, not like in Mariupol or Kharkov. But the wife and children are very afraid, several times war plane flew right overhead at a low altitude, rocket explosions have so far only been heard. My wife is afraid to leave Ukraine without me, we were preparing to go abroad all together, I am not fit for military service even in wartime and we should be released. We need this money now more than ever. I really hope for your understanding of my situation. I myself never took anything from someone else, even the phones that I found more than once always returned to the owners. Thank you in advance. I apologize for my English, I used google translate.
source: Hello, my name is Andrey. I work as a computer repairer and software tuner. I go to people's homes and help them solve their computer problems. We call it emergency computer help. This job brings in very little money. In my free time, I participate in ambassador programs and incentivized testnets of various blockchain projects. Here are some projects I've been involved with NuCypher, Harmony, Avalanche, Elrond, Solana, Stafi, CertiK, XX network, Akash, Mina, Blockstack, Keep, Bitsong, Mina. I accumulated several years of rewards from these events, saved for my retirement and hoped to buy a house. I am already 41 years old. I have a wife and two children aged 7 and 9. We live in Ukraine, the city of Dnipro. So far, we are relatively calm, not like in Mariupol or Kharkov. But the wife and children are very afraid, several times war plane flew right overhead at a low altitude, rocket explosions have so far only been heard. My wife is afraid to leave Ukraine without me, we were preparing to go abroad all together, I am not fit for military service even in wartime and we should be released. We need this money now more than ever. I really hope for your understanding of my situation. I myself never took anything from someone else, even the phones that I found more than once always returned to the owners. Thank you in advance. I apologize for my English, I used google translate.

messageText:
I'm sorry. I wouldn't even pretend I have had any affliations with Cashio at the moment of the attack. I come from a country domineered and trumpled by a dictator who wants blood and war, and nothing more. I need to flee out of here, to try go living some safer place, to save myself and my family. I thought, what if you can help me out. I need a lot of money to relocate, like thousands of dollars, and I'm desperate. But what if you can just help me out with whatever you think you could give away... I'm sorry for asking, but every day it gets worth. I have a feeling it will never be good again. 
I am a translator, a good one. I earned money just enough for living.
But Russian language becomes less popular nowadays. People hate us, and we hate ourselves for not being able to stop this.
I never chose a man who is driving this world insane.
I am scared, and I want to act, but it seems I can act only if I leave this country, otherwise I'll be fined and put in jail just like everyone else who was brave enough to oppose.
I need money to fight for the world and to save my family.
My current salary is $500 a month, and there is no way I can afford leaving on these terms...
I've been applying for jobs abroad, but since I'm a translator (and can't do much beyond that), I'm not really successful in these applications.

Thank you for your time, for reading this.

Just if you feel you are in position to help... My ETH address...
0x48786B7ddFE681beFC5315a75Eb26F96DcDa4a84

I hope it's the right one, I am new to Ethereum.
Please don't think bad of me. I amd seizing all opportunities I have...

Нет войне. Я за мир во всём мире. Я плачу каждый день, читая новости. Когда это всё закончится, когда мы отстроим разрушенные нами города, только тогда мир станет лучше.

I'm not married yet, and I wish I could have my own family in the next few years, but now I don't have a car, a house, or even nothing, and I feel hopeless for the future.
The official news these days gives me hope, I don't know if $100,000 is on your refund list or not, but I really hope to wake up one morning and see my money back because That is my family's hope for the future, thank you.
My English is not good, I hope you can understand what I mean, thank you again.

6. The source of money: My 6-month saving at the start-up crypto company I'm currently working at (the salary of Vietnam crypto companies are extremely low).

As rewarded with volatile assets, I was hoping to leverage my capital (salary) which is pretty low (compared to average crypto users) by using my C98 and providing liquidity for C98/CASH.

With this exploit going on, I had almost nothing left, except some few C98 that I borrowed from my colleague after the hack. I borrowed it to find some other exposure with C98 on Solana in an attempt to outperform my loss. However, as I found no other alternatives, I decided to return the funds, and sitting with literally $0 in my account.

Life has been incredibly difficult and stressful for me as a 20 year old university sophomore. I'm trying to "skin in the game" and get exposure to DeFi, and has already got rekt after 3 months with 3 exploits (Cashio, Grim Finance, Tinyman).

I hope nothing but the return of my worthwhile funds. Sincere thanks to anyone to do this, should it happen.

I hope nothing but the return of my worthwhile funds. Sincere thanks to anyone to do this, should it happen.

I borrowed more money from my friends and my family to invest in Cashio since then. However, I lost a lot and do not know what to do before this announcement for refund.
I would express my sincere thank to your refund from the bottom of my heart. Since I am still indebted about my borrowing, I hope for your charity would give me a helping hand too.

As a result of this conflict, there are many people who need help and support.

6. Who you stole from? A 29 year old from Puerto Rico, newly married & trying to start a family and a charitable organization which entrusted funds to me for low risk investments. I wrongly believed stablecoin pools were a safe, high return product and regret the undiversified exposure I took on its behalf and with our own savings. The private foundation focuses its support towards drug addiction and rehabilitation, following the passing of my Uncle & Brother-in-Law to fentanyl during the pandemic. Losing any money donated in their memory pains me beyond repair.
Why the funds should be returned? Most of my stolen funds are already earmarked for charitable causes, but may never actually be able to be used for good given the exploited wallet's current flagged status. Personally, the loss puts at risk my fiduciary involvement with the foundation, erases years of frugality and devastates my confidence and belief in the future good that DeFi can do. For my family, the hack jeopardizes my wife and my hopes to become first-time homeowners and raise our future children in a healthy and secure environment. We have always dreamt of having a large family and someday adopting, but without our savings or stable finances that all may have to be put on hold.

5. $197,620.21 of USDC into the CASH-USDC LP.
6. I am not rich (and not a "crypto millionaire" like so many). I need this money. I am a working father with a toddler and newborn. I took my savings and moved it onto the blockchain for a "safe" way to find investment yields without the risk of the market (my savings account was giving me no return). I moved this money onto the blockchain from my savings account (fiat to FTX over to Phantom). I need this money back because it is the support for my family, which is what I work so hard for (just like every dad, I hope if something happens to me, this savings will help my family get by). Last year we had our second child and the year before that I had open heart surgery, both of these years had very expensive medical bills which I make monthly payments on. Looking back I wish I would have used this money to pay off medical bills rather than trying to earn interest to pay them off. The honest answer is I need this money back because it took me many years to earn this amount and I have payment obligations that I need the money for (or the interest I was earning on it, which I was "farming" almost daily"). I don't come from money (both parents work at grocery stores and are still working) and general life expenses (and kids) have made saving hard. I saw you returned all money to those under $100,000, which was the right thing to do - I hope you can do the same for those of us under $200,000. This money means a lot to me and my family.

6. Hello, I am originally from Western Siberia and spent most of my life there. This money belongs to me and my family, our lifetime savings. I am native Ukrainian holding a Russian passport and in the first place I’d like to mention that our family does not support the war in Ukraine and consider Putin a war criminal! There is a real war going on where the country I live is attacking the country of my grandparents. We didn’t choose to become in this situation, never voted for the current criminal government or supported them in any way. It is becoming more like Northern Korea than the USSR. I will try to explain the situation without going too much into personal details since I cannot go fully public to avoid criminal prosecution for just saying as above. My grandparents are 100% Ukrainian and I have cousins there, but now most of the family is still in Siberia, that is a quite common reality for the people here. We are not American, nor European and never inherited wealth, never ran any big business, never stole any money from anyone, never enjoyed any social bonuses that western countries provided, just average people. We had to survive in poverty during the 1990s after the USSR collapsed. In fact, I am the only member of the family who speaks more or less good English and understands something about crypto. My mom is Ukrainian, she was a scientist but now she is 75 and her medical conditions worsen every year. She has Parkinson's disease along with the heart condition and could barely look after herself. We had to hire a helper to assist with her day-to day care as it is becoming a full-time job. She needs a lot of necessary treatments, like PDS operation which cannot be done in Siberia, and the cost alone is around $50k and the overall costs may be well above $250k if considering traveling to another country, following support and hospital costs etc. There is no insurance coverage for that, none of us had anything like insurance! Her pension is only around $200/month, quite average for these realities. My father is 75 as well, he is better but he still could not retire and will continue working full-time as a uni professor because the cost of living is worsening every day and the medical expenses are just keep growing up, they jumped 20% for the last month and keep going. His salary is probably $500-600 a month since the ruble collapsed ~3x for the last few years. My father’s new wife has barely no income right now and his son (my stepbrother) is a student with just pocket cash and sporadic income. I still have to support them as a part of my family and they rely on the funds also. My wife has a part-time job as a photographer and she supports her old mother as well. Her sister is working a low-paying job, maybe $300/month and her niece is a young medical student with no hope of getting a high-paying job. Doctors do not earn much in this part of the world either.
Our cousins are in Ukraine, right now we lost contact with them because of the war, people really suffer there, russian troops destroy Ukrainian cities with no mercy and we could not afford going there seeking them right now.  Most likely they need immediate help. My sister and her husband are just average, they are paying mortgage and work 9-7 during the week, average salary may be close to $500-600 right now with the rub/usd rate as of now. I was never a high earner either, just a programmer. In Siberia my top salary would be $1000/month. I was the only person to be able to manage the funds for the all these people, made stupid mistake of creating a concentration in Cashio and feel deeply responsible for the situation. More about the situation here: the inflation has hit 2%/week just recently, there is no sugar in the stores, some items got 16-20% more expensive and the situation keeps worsening because of the war and the sanctions. Unemployment keeps growing and the criminal situation will only worsen. Lots of people are quite anxious and depressed because of what is happening, they have no choice to oppose the totalitarian regime as it is quite easy to get big fines, jail time or get tortures by the police. We were hoping the funds would help to cover the needs during the hard times and now when they came we lost them with no hope of earning them back again. Some of us had to take cash loans to support the immediate needs but I see no opportunity to repay them considering the interest rates of 20% and above. All of us are anxious and stressed, we see no way of earning the funds back and see no hope for a brighter future. I apologize for the lengthy and sporadic message, just tried to explain the situation the way it is. If you need more facts, details or other evidence, please reach me on TOX A15F4A5ED4DF12385241C797E8920ECB945410F20D296B57266E074380266D4FAC1DD3FC0F14 or email dmytro9@protonmail.com

I will be going to the U.S. next month to study abroad for a long term to get my Ph.D. in pharmacy.
I have been working part-time along with my studies for the past 6 years since I entered university, and most of the money I earned, along with my student loan, was deposited into Saber.

I will be going to the U.S. next month to study abroad for a long term to get my Ph.D. in pharmacy.
I have been working part-time along with my studies for the past 6 years since I entered university, and most of the money I earned, along with my student loan, was deposited into Saber.
This was in order to further save money for living expenses through stable yield and to focus on my research in the US.
In hindsight, this was a foolish act. You know the result.
Before the hack, I had $12,6000, but now I have only about $23,000, including some crypto that was not deposited in Saber.
Next month I will start paying off tuition, rent and living expenses in the US as well as my previous student loan, so with the remaining money I can only live in the US for a few months and my dream of getting a Ph.D. and inventing future medicines for people will be over.
Could you please return my money?
I hope for your generous action.
Thank you for reading my long, poorly written English.

6. I am very new to crypto and found a project in Saber I thought I could trust and got duped by their marketing so I accept my stupidity.
I have spent the past 10 years of my life religiously saving up to try and finally escape the rat race, working long hours. I managed to save by reducing my living costs and investing a small part each month.
I thought this was a financial opportunity to give me some freedom from working long hours. I was wrong.
I got in a position this year to quit my job to try and become financially independent, and I made a stupid mistake to put it in a liquidity pool with a high APY thinking it was safe.
But unfortunately it has been my single biggest mistake and has ruined my life, and I feel that all my hard work from the past years has just vanished with this hack and I’m back to zero again. I have been really struggling mentally this past week.
I certainly don’t want to lie to you. I’m European, but I’m not from a rich European country. This was all the money I have to live, and 195,000 is less than a small flat.
In summary, I saved this this money to feel comfortable and just to live and not get sick from overworking. It won’t buy me lambo or whatever, but just cover my living costs and my $170k loan on my flat I need to pay.
I do appreciate you at least contacted us with all the misinformation and silence we had to deal with from the team in the past few days.
I just don’t want to start from square one again. I hope you can consider my request. It would kill me inside knowing I have to work another 12-15 years trying to save this money and build my life back.
Thank you.

Dear Sir or Madam, 

I sincerely apologize in advance for the length of this message. The reality is that I do not know what exactly to say or where to start, so I will just speak from my heart because I have no other choice.

Before I begin, I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for having the mercy to consider my request. I know you have no reason to believe me or anyone else submitting requests for refunds. I also know that you must be receiving vitriolic and hateful messages every day. I will not be one of them. The reality is that even if I did hate you, which I do not, I could never hate you more than I already hate myself.


The reality is that I was already suicidal before the night I discovered the exploit. I have been battling PTSD and treatment resistant depression all my life. That said, the CASHIO exploit has put me over the edge, and I am struggling to find reasons to live as I write this. I can share any and all medical records evidencing my lifelong battle with treatment resistant depression. I have tried everything, including Electroconvulsive Therapy (i.e., induced seizures) in 2016 and ketamine infusions in 2020. I can share evidence of these treatments upon your request. As I write this message, I am heavily medicated and fighting severe anxiety. I sincerely thank you for taking the time to read this. I will do whatever you demand of me to get this money back. I have no ego.

Before I address the source of funds, kindly allow me to first tell you more about me, which will lend color as to my psychological state, and then I will explain the source of funds and why I need them back.

I am Kashmiri. That means I am from Kashmir, a wartorn, disputed territory in South Asia that has been under military occupation by India and Pakistan since the late 1980s, with both direct and indirect facilitation by the United States, who has done absolutely nothing to help the innocent Kashmiri people, my people. The Kashmiri people are disenfranchised and have no future. They have no autonomy or control over their fate. I have lost innocent family members and my closest friends to senseless violence. I have personally held, in my arms, three innocent cousins shot to death by the military in Srinagar, Kashmir. Other family members of mine have been raped and physically abused, their homes destroyed for no reason. You may now understand that it is no coincidence that I have suffered from PTSD and severe depression all my life. If you are unfamiliar with Kashmir or the conflict there, I humbly request you research Kashmir for just 5 minutes on the internet to confirm my representations. I want you to know that the foreign policies and actions of the United States are directly and indirectly responsible for the death of my family members and loved ones in Kashmir and the fate of Kashmir itself. Like you, I understand at least as much as anyone else that the United States has profited off of the military industrial complex for a very long time. I understand more than anyone else your aversion to wealthy people in the United States and Europe who do not care for human beings elsewhere. Truly, there are good and bad people all over the world. 

My family fled Kashmir in the late 80s at the peak of violence in Srinagar, the capital of Kashmir, with ~$1,000 - $2,000 (impossible to know the exact amount - this is what my mother tells me). I am my parents’ only son.  Needless to say, I grew up poor. One of my earliest childhood memories is my parents giving me a birthday present in an unlabeled box. In the box were a pair of used LA Gear shoes from Payless - the shoes probably cost $20 brand new and probably $2 used. Even as a kid, at that moment, I realized how little we had. As I grew older, around age 11, when I was conscious enough to understand the world and my family’s plight, I dedicated my life to making sure that both my immediate and extended family would never feel powerless again. More specifically, I dedicated my life to making as much money for my family because only someone who has experienced abject poverty can understand the importance of money.

Growing up, my parents always stressed the value of education, and yet, I only saw education as a means to making money - that was my only mission. I am not proud of this, and I am not saying that education does not matter. I am simply saying that it did not matter more to me than making money. So, I worked as hard as I could in school to get the best job I could get after graduation. After starting work, I saved as much money as I could after taxes. In 2017, I discovered Bitcoin. It immediately resonated with me because as a Kashmiri, whose nation was stripped of its autonomy and self-governance overnight, I knew better than anyone else the power of a non-sovereign, digital store of wealth. Bitcoin represented and still represents hope to me and other disenfranchised populations around the world. It represents freedom from rogue nations and wealthy, profiteering governments. Ever since discovering Bitcoin, I pooled whatever I could from my family and extended family to invest in crypto because I believed it would be the “future” and one of the best investments ever. Fast forward to January 2022, and the thousands of dollars I originally invested for my family and myself was suddenly worth millions. It was at that point in January 2022 (you can track this on chain) that I decided I had made enough for my family and me, more than I could ever dream of, so I decided to put the money in a “safe” yield generating vehicle with no impermanent loss - that vehicle was the CASH-UST LP on Quarry. So, to be clear, the source of the funds I lost in the CASHIO exploit is the vast majority of my years of accumulated money from investing both my family’s and my own money dating back to 2017. I started with about $80K in total. The reason there is $2,873,321.20338 of funds lost in this CASHIO exploit is NOT because I came from money. It is because I invested everything I could (~ $80K) in crypto in 2017 to change my family members’ lives forever. When I put the money in the UST-CASH LP on Quarry and CASH in January 2022, it was with the intention of finally focusing my attention on my lifelong battle with severe depression and PTSD from my childhood, while still growing the accumulated wealth passively. My family has been begging me to take care of myself once and for all, and I was finally ready to save my own life. Again, I can prove everything I am saying. Please feel free to ask me for proof.

Now that I have explained the source of funds, I hope it is clear why I need the money back. This money is not only mine. It is my family’s as well. They do not know anything about crypto. They are Kashmiri refugees whose biggest accomplishment was surviving and fleeing Kashmir in the 80s. It is not the money of those with intergenerational wealth or trust fund babies in America or Europe. This is the money of those who deserve it. This is the best kind of money, it is the money made by people who grew up with nothing and made every dime by their own efforts. It is the money of people whose people were raped and pillaged by powerful governments in a conflict that rages on even today. 

I am officially broken and have nothing left in me. As I stated above several times, I will do whatever you require to prove to you that my story is real. I have nothing to lose and everything to gain. I have no ego and only respect for you. The reality is that most people who pulled off the exploit you executed flawlessly would never return the money. It is clear you have a heart, and I pray to the powers that be that you can feel mine through this message. If you are ever able to see my medical history, you will understand that you can truly save my life and the lives of my parents, who are in their elder years, and truly cannot bear the pain of seeing their son deteriorate.  

With head on the floor, I request your mercy. My best,

A boy from Srinagar, Kashmir all grown up and trying to support my family and save my own life

I am supporting my mother who recently quit her job due to health issues and my brother who works as a app food delivery courier. We all live share a tiny 1.5 bedroom flat. The money here was more than 60% of my savings. I put my money into stablecoin because I wanted safety and I was advised this was safe activity. I am thankful that I had withdrawn about 20% of it a few months ago, so I still have some money to survive. But due to the low wages and high cost of living in Hong Kong, I will need to be working more hours for the rest of my life. This event has been very painful for my family. Please consider helping me. I am thankful for the opportunity you have given.

Dear Sir, I am from the Philippines. I invested all of the money my parents had. Last year, I invested my savings into SOL. When my parents saw the money I was making, they asked me to teach them. I told them to do DeFi stablecoin staking because they were retired, and I eventually convinced them to stake their savings in Saber. I told them there was no risk, so they eventually sold their fish ponds in the province and I put everything into CASH-USDC LP. They have nothing left.

I now need to support my parents because they are too old to work. My monthly salary (US$800) is not enough for me to take care of them, unless they move back to the province. This is very difficult because my job is in the city, and I need to live with my parents because they cannot take care of themselves. Thank you for your consideration.
